00020 
00021 // Lattice that stores the structure of the sequence iterated by a variable
00022 // or an array access
00023 class SeqStructLattice : public FiniteLattice
00024 {
00025         public:
00026         // The sequence's starting and ending points
00027         varID vInit;
00028         varID vFin;
00029         // The sequence's stride
00030         int s;
00031         
00032         public:
00033         // The different levels of this lattice
00034         typedef enum {
00035                 // This object is uninitialized
00036                 uninitialized=0,
00037                 // No information is known about the sequence
00038                 bottom=1,
00039                 // The starting point of the sequence is known (vInit==vFin and s==0)
00040                 startKnown=2,
00041                 // The structure of the sequence is known (s!=0)
00042                 seqKnown=3,
00043                 // The sequence of values that this variable passes through is more complex than what 
00044                 // can be represented using a lower/upper bound and a constant stride
00045                 top=4} seqLevel;
00046         
00047         private:
00048         // This object's current level in the lattice: (uninitialized, bottom, startKnown, seqKnown, top)
00049         seqLevel level;
00050         
00051         // The constraint graph associated with the same DataflowNode as this lattice and that holds
00052         // the relationships between vInit, vFin and other variables.
00053         ConstrGraph* cg;
00054         
00055         // The analysis that identifies the dominator relationships between DataflowNodes
00056         DominatorAnalysis* dom;
00057         
00058         // The DataflowNode that this lattice corresponds to
00059         const DataflowNode& n;
00060         
00061         public:
00062         // Initializes the lattice to level=uninitialized
00063         SeqStructLattice(ConstrGraph* cg, const DataflowNode& n, string indent="");
00064         
00065         // Initializes the lattice to level=startKnown and this->vInit=this->vFin=vInit
00066         SeqStructLattice(ConstrGraph* cg, const DataflowNode& n, const varID& vInit, int startOffset, string indent="");
00067         // Initializes the lattice to level=startKnown and this->vInit=this->vFin=init
00068         SeqStructLattice(ConstrGraph* cg, const DataflowNode& n, int initVal, string indent="");
00069         
00070         // Initializes the lattice to level=seqKnown and this->vInit=initV this->vFin=finV, this->s=s
00071         SeqStructLattice(ConstrGraph* cg, const DataflowNode& n, const varID& initV, const varID& finV, int s, string indent="");
00072         // Initializes the lattice to level=seqKnown and this->vInit=initV this->vFin=finV, this->s=s
00073         SeqStructLattice(ConstrGraph* cg, const DataflowNode& n, int initV, int finV, int s, string indent="");
00074                 
00075         protected:      
00076         // Common initialization code for SeqStructLattice
00077         void init(string indent="");
00078                 
00079         public:
00080         // Copy constructor
00081         SeqStructLattice(const SeqStructLattice& that, string indent="");
00082         
00083         protected:      
00084         // Copies the state from That sequence to This. Returns true if this causes This to change and false otherwise.
00085         bool copyFrom(const SeqStructLattice& that, string indent="");
00086         
00087         public:
00088         // Initializes this Lattice to its default state, if it is not already initialized
00089         void initialize();
00090         
00091         // Returns a copy of this lattice
00092         Lattice* copy() const;
00093         
00094         // Overwrites the state of this Lattice with that of that Lattice
00095         void copy(Lattice* that);
00096         
00097         // Called by analyses to create a copy of this lattice. However, if this lattice maintains any 
00098         //    information on a per-variable basis, these per-variable mappings must be converted from 
00099         //    the current set of variables to another set. This may be needed during function calls, 
00100         //    when dataflow information from the caller/callee needs to be transferred to the callee/calleer.
00101         // We do not force child classes to define their own versions of this function since not all
00102         //    Lattices have per-variable information.
00103         // varNameMap - maps all variable names that have changed, in each mapping pair, pair->first is the 
00104         //              old variable and pair->second is the new variable
00105         // func - the function that the copy Lattice will now be associated with
00106         void remapVars(const map<varID, varID>& varNameMap, const Function& newFunc);
00107         
00108         // Called by analyses to copy over from the that Lattice dataflow information into this Lattice.
00109         // that contains data for a set of variables and incorporateVars must overwrite the state of just
00110         // those variables, while leaving its state for other variables alone.
00111         // We do not force child classes to define their own versions of this function since not all
00112         //    Lattices have per-variable information.
00113         void incorporateVars(Lattice* that_arg);
00114         
00115         // Returns a Lattice that describes the information known within this lattice
00116         // about the given expression. By default this could be the entire lattice or any portion of it.
00117         // For example, a lattice that maintains lattices for different known variables and expression will 
00118         // return a lattice for the given expression. Similarly, a lattice that keeps track of constraints
00119         // on values of variables and expressions will return the portion of the lattice that relates to
00120         // the given expression. 
00121         // It it legal for this function to return NULL if no information is available.
00122         // The function's caller is responsible for deallocating the returned object
00123         Lattice* project(SgExpression* expr);
00124         
00125         // The inverse of project(). The call is provided with an expression and a Lattice that describes
00126         // the dataflow state that relates to expression. This Lattice must be of the same type as the lattice
00127         // returned by project(). unProject() must incorporate this dataflow state into the overall state it holds.
00128         // Call must make an internal copy of the passed-in lattice and the caller is responsible for deallocating it.
00129         // Returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise.
00130         bool unProject(SgExpression* expr, Lattice* exprState);
00131         
00132         // Computes the meet of this and that and saves the result in this
00133         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00134         bool meetUpdate(Lattice* that_arg);
00135         
00136         // Set the level of this object to Bottom.
00137         // Return true if this causes ths Lattice to change and false otherwise.
00138         bool setToBottom();
00139         
00140         // Set the level of this object to Top.
00141         // Return true if this causes ths Lattice to change and false otherwise.
00142         bool setToTop();
00143         
00144         // Set the level of this object to startKnown, with the given variable starting point (vInit + startOffset).
00145         // Return true if this causes ths Lattice to change and false otherwise.
00146         bool setToStartKnown(varID vInit, int initOffset);
00147                 
00148         // Set the level of this object to startKnown, with the given constant starting point.
00149         // Return true if this causes ths Lattice to change and false otherwise.
00150         bool setToStartKnown(int initVal);
00151         
00152         // Set the level of this object to seqKnown, with the given final point and stride
00153         // Return true if this causes ths Lattice to change and false otherwise.
00154         bool setToSeqKnown(varID vFin, int finOffset, int stride);
00155         
00156         // Return this lattice's level
00157         seqLevel getLevel() const;
00158         
00159         bool operator==(Lattice* that);
00160                         
00161         // The string that represents this object
00162         // If indent!="", every line of this string must be prefixed by indent
00163         // The last character of the returned string should not be '\n', even if it is a multi-line string.
00164         string str(string indent="");
00165 };
00166 
00167 class SeqStructAnalysis : public IntraFWDataflow
00168 {
00169         protected:
00170         static map<varID, Lattice*> constVars;
00171         static bool constVars_init;
00172         
00173         // The LiveDeadVarsAnalysis that identifies the live/dead state of all application variables.
00174         // Needed to create a FiniteVarsExprsProductLattice.
00175         LiveDeadVarsAnalysis* ldva;
00176         
00177         // The DivAnalysis that computes information required for the construction of constraint graphs
00178         DivAnalysis* divAnalysis;
00179         
00180         // The analysis that will be executed concurrently with this analysis and will maintain the relationships 
00181         // between variables as well as SeqStructLattice initial and final values using ConstrGraphs
00182         ConstrGraphAnalysis* cgAnalysis;
00183         
00184         public:
00185         SeqStructAnalysis(LiveDeadVarsAnalysis* ldva, DivAnalysis* divAnalysis): IntraFWDataflow()
00186         {       
00187                 this->ldva = ldva;
00188                 this->divAnalysis   = divAnalysis;
00189                 cgAnalysis = new ConstrGraphAnalysis(ldva, divAnalysis);
00190         }
00191         
00192         // generates the initial lattice state for the given dataflow node, in the given function, with the given NodeState
00193         //vector<Lattice*> genInitState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state);
00194         void genInitState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state,
00195                           vector<Lattice*>& initLattices, vector<NodeFact*>& initFacts);
00196         
00197         // Returns a map of special constant variables (such as zeroVar) and the lattices that correspond to them
00198         // These lattices are assumed to be constants: it is assumed that they are never modified and it is legal to 
00199         //    maintain only one copy of each lattice may for the duration of the analysis.
00200         //map<varID, Lattice*>& genConstVarLattices() const;
00201                 
00202         bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state, const vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo);
00203 };

00206 void printSeqStructAnalysisStates(SeqStructAnalysis* ssa, string indent="");
